Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 3rd overall pick, by Atlanta in 1966...
Traded from Atlanta to Pittsburgh on 1/31/1968 (Going to PIT: CF L. Hisle, RF J. Hague. Going to ATL: CF R. Clemente)...
Injured on 4/3/1969 with a Stiff Neck, out for 5 days...
Injured on 5/12/1969 with a Bruised Hand, out for 2 days...
Injured on 8/12/1969 with a Bruised Neck, out for 5 days...
Had first career hit on 4/1/1970, off Paul Edmondson (LA)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/2/1970, off Clay Carroll (ATL)...
Won Gold Glove Award at Centerfield in 1970...
Drove in 6 runs against New York (N) on 5/24/1972...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/15/1973, hitting .481 with 4 HR, 7 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 8/1/1974, hitting .371 with 3 HR, 17 RBI...
